messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] ATT poll on homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: I just went and voted...I cannot believe that there are 27% of the voters that think it hurts :o)  Boy, they must not know too many homeschooled/unschooled
messages.messageBody:
I just went and voted...I cannot believe that there are 27% of the voters that think it hurts :o) Boy, they must not know too many homeschooled/unschooled children!!!

Jessi

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] ATT poll on homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... And where s the box for No, it improves their social development ? Talk about a skewed question!  I did vote though. -Lisa in AZ
messages.messageBody:
> << Do you think homeschooling a child hurts his/her social development?
> <http://www.att.net/>
> bottom of page. >>
>
> I went and voted, but it's useless. What most people think "Social
> development" means is the shut-down, hard hide it takes to survive
> school.

And where's the box for "No, it improves their social development"?
Talk about a skewed question! I did vote though.

-Lisa in AZ

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] ATT poll on homeschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think there is a place to click to discuss the poll or something. If you re interested . -pam National Home Education Network  Serving
messages.messageBody:
On Feb 27, 2004, at 9:33 AM, SandraDodd@... wrote:

> << Do you think homeschooling a child hurts his/her social development?
>
> <http://www.att.net/>
>
> bottom of page. >>
>
> I went and voted, but it's useless. What most people think "Social
> development" means is the shut-down, hard hide it takes to survive
> school.

I think there is a place to click to "discuss the poll" or something.
If you're interested <G>.

-pam
National Home Education Network
<www.NHEN.org>
Serving the entire homeschooling community since 1999
through information, networking and public relations.
